metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6458 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Multiple buffer overflows in the ctl_put* functions in NTP before 4.2.8p10 and 4.3.x before 4.3.94 allow remote authenticated users to have unspecified impact via a long variable.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is not a vulnerability per se, but a weakness in an internal helper function

criterions.comment: ntp package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1').
